body_html: @peterjc123 I just tried the package you provided before (0.1.12, compiled with CUDA 8.0, I've been using it for a while, thanks a lot) on a different node (CUDA 9.0) of the cluster. Surprisingly it seems to be working. So I tried to upgrade my local server to CUDA 9.0 and the driver to the latest version, and it also worked. I am not even aware that CUDA is backward compatible, is it?

body: @peterjc123 I just tried the package you provided before (0.1.12, compiled with CUDA 8.0, I've been using it for a while, thanks a lot) on a different node (CUDA 9.0) of the cluster. Surprisingly it seems to be working. So I tried to upgrade my local server to CUDA 9.0 and the driver to the latest version, and it also worked. I am not even aware that CUDA is backward compatible, is it?
